title: US Congress passes new election rules in response to January 6
description: New provisions to US Electoral Count Act make it more difficult for politicians to prevent peaceful transfer of power.

title: Bankman-Fried, FTX execs received billions in hidden loans
description: Caroline Ellison, Bankman-Fried's colleague, said she agreed with him to hide the loans from FTX investors.

title: Britain’s health workers announce more strikes for 2023
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak says he is 'sad' and 'disappointed' about widespread strikes but refuses to negotiate.

title: US House passes massive $1.7 trillion spending bill
description: Bill boosts military spending by 10 percent to a total of $858bn, alongside $772.5bn for domestic programmes.

title: 5 key takeaways from January 6 panel’s report on US Capitol riot
description: Donald Trump led 'multi-part conspiracy' to overturn 2020 elections that ended in deadly riot, US committee says.

title: Putin tells defence chiefs to do more for troops in Ukraine
description: Russian leader says the country's military-industrial complex should provide the army with everything they need.

title: Could the world be facing another major coronavirus outbreak?
description: COVID infections are rising in China and there are growing fears that new variants could emerge.

title: Photos: Massive winter storm pummels US and Canada
description: Frigid temperatures, snow and ice have upended travel plans and knocked out power to thousands of homes and businesses.

title: Billionaire Adani to own 65% of India’s NDTV as founders sell
description: NDTV founders Radhika and Prannoy Roy made several unsuccessful attempts to block the takeover by Gautam Adani.

title: UN envoy calls for pressure on Taliban over women university ban
description: Gordon Brown urges more leaders in Islamic countries to denounce a move barring Afghan women from higher education.

title: Chile declares state of emergency after wildfire leaves one dead
description: Massive blaze near the tourist city of Vina del Mar has killed at least one person and destroyed about 200 homes.

title: US consumer spending, inflation cool in November
description: While economic activity is slowing amid rising interest rates, it's not enough to discourage US Fed from more rises.

title: Media mogul Mike Bloomberg looks to buy WSJ or WaPo: Report
description: A merger would create a financial data and news giant, further firming up the world's 12th-richest man's stronghold.

title: Facebook parent Meta to pay $725m in Cambridge Analytica scandal
description: Agreed settlement is largest in US data privacy class action and the biggest class action lawsuit for Meta.

title: The Case for the Climate
description: earthrise meets some of the environmental campaigners and lawyers who are forcing systemic change through the courts.

title: Photos: After heavy combat, Ukrainians in east brace for cold
description: Villages in the Donetsk region have seen heavy fighting, and now residents are facing a new threat: a bitter winter.

title: Burkina Faso government expels senior UN official
description: Violence from multiple armed groups in Burkina Faso has displaced more than two million people.

title: Spain absolves border agents over Melilla asylum seeker deaths
description: At least 23 people died after a mass storming of the border crossing between Morocco and the Spanish enclave.

title: M23 rebels pledge to retreat from key position in eastern DRC
description: Violence from the group has caused hundreds of thousands of people to flee in fear from the DRC's volatile east region.

title: One-day tally of COVID cases in China hits 37 million: Report
description: The latest figures deviate significantly from official data sparking concerns over China's transparency on the issue.

title: Togo presidency to oversee armed forces amid security woes
description: The move comes after recent incidents of armed group activity in the country's north, near the border with Burkina Faso.

title: Economic ties head the agenda as Italy’s Meloni visits Iraq
description: Meloni, who is in Baghdad on her first bilateral trip outside Europe, hailed Italy's support for Iraq.

title: England’s Sam Curran becomes most expensive IPL player
description: Punjab Kings agreed to pay $2.23m for the all-rounder at the Indian cricket league's auction of players.

title: Indian activist Umar Khalid gets a week’s bail — and a gag order
description: A court awarded Khalid a seven-day reprieve to attend his sister's wedding, after more than two years in jail.

title: Looking at Berlin’s present through its past
description: What can an exhibition on 19th-century migrants in Berlin tell us about Germany's current relationship with migration?

title: Q&A: Uganda’s Museveni on staying in power, rights abuses
description: The Museveni administration has repeatedly been accused of muzzling dissenting voices in the country since 1986.

title: Japan unveils record defence budget amid regional security fears
description: The cabinet's nod for a 20-percent rise in military spending is a deviation from pacifist post-WWII self-defence policy.

title: Shell to pay $15m settlement over oil spills in Nigeria
description: Shell claimed the settlement for spills in the Niger Delta between 2004 and 2007 was not an admission of liability.

title: At least two people dead after shooting in Paris
description: Gunshots were fired in a central district of Paris, injuring several people.

title: COP15 was a success — here’s what needs to happen next
description: The historic global agreement at the UN conference to halt and reverse biodiversity loss by 2030 is just the start.

title: Passport control staff strike at six UK airports for better pay
description: More than 1,000 Border Force officers walk out at six airports over pay amid the cost-of-living crisis.

title: Heavy snow and plunging temperatures: What is a bomb cyclone?
description: The United States braces for a cold snap as wind-chill temperatures could drop to dangerous levels far below zero.

title: Lobster bisque for the blues
description: A father and daughter’s journey through sadness and seafood.

title: Russia threatens to slash oil supplies in 2023, spooks markets
description: Moscow warns it may cut production by 5-7 percent in early 2023 as energy war with the West deepens.

title: Suicide car bomb kills Pakistan police officer, wounds others
description: Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan claims responsibility for explosion near police headquarters in Islamabad.

title: Israeli police kill Palestinian, accuse him of ‘attack’
description: Family denies the Palestinian citizen of Israel had attempted to ram Israeli officers with a car in Kafr Qasim.

title: Winter ‘bomb cyclone’ looms ahead of US holiday weekend
description: A 'once-in-a-generation' winter storm with temperatures as low as -40 degrees Celsius causes Christmas travel chaos.

title: Timeline: Case of Charles Sobhraj – ‘Bikini Killer’, ‘Serpent’
description: The French serial killer preyed on Western tourists on the 'hippie trail' in Asia in the 1970s and 1980s.

title: French serial killer Charles Sobhraj released from Nepal prison
description: He spent 19 years in jail in Nepal for two murders in 1975 and was freed given his age and for good behaviour.

title: Children can help us build a better, greener world for all
description: Children are bearing the brunt of the world’s ills. Let’s ensure their voices are heard.

title: China’s foreign minister warns US not to cross its ‘red line’
description: Wang Yi accuses the US of 'salami slicing' tactics and 'bullying' in a call with Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

title: Powerful Tunisian trade union calls for postponement of vote
description: UGTT says second round will cause chaos after a record-low turnout in the first round of parliamentary elections.

title: N Korea fires 2 ballistic missiles towards eastern waters: South
description: Latest launch comes days after joint air exercise by South Korean and US militaries.

title: Thomas Piketty: ‘You have to make the richest people pay more’
description: Renowned economist Thomas Piketty on the politics of building global equality.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 303
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 303rd day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Apple’s Australian workers go on Christmas strike over pay
description: Strike comes as tech giant is facing disruption at its flagship iPhone plant in China after workers' protests.

title: Cambodia convicts 36 opposition members in latest mass trial
description: Mass trial of Cambodia's opposition leaders and supporters results in guilty verdicts for all but one defendant.

title: Japan’s inflation hits 40-year high
description: Prices rise 3.7 percent in November amid growing expectations central bank will roll back huge stimulus.

title: US says Putin’s call to end war in Ukraine insincere
description: 'Our goal is not to spin the flywheel of military conflict,' Russian President Vladimir Putin said.

title: As Indonesia woos investors, ‘sex ban’ laws convolute sales pitch
description: Southeast Asian country's businesses community is divided on how revised code will affect efforts to attract investment.

title: January 6 panel unveils report, describes Trump ‘conspiracy’
description: Jan 6 committee’s final report asserts Donald Trump engaged in a 'multi-part conspiracy' to overturn 2020 election.

title: Russia considers ways to return space crew after capsule leak
description: Tests are being conducted to determine whether Soyuz capsule is unfit for crewed flight after coolant leak.

title: N Korea denies arms supplied for Russian mercenaries in Ukraine
description: US claims North Korea sent 'infantry rockets and missiles into Russia' for use by Wagner Group mercenaries in Ukraine.

title: TikTok staff accessed data to track journalists, ByteDance finds
description: Chinese parent company of popular video app says the employees responsible are no longer with the company.

title: Argentina identifies 131st baby kidnapped during dictatorship
description: A right-wing dictatorship that ruled Argentina from 1976 to 1983 systematically stole children from dissident parents.

title: US Senate passes $1.7t spending bill without Afghan refugee law
description: The 4,155-page spending bill includes $858bn for military spending and $45bn in additional assistance for Ukraine.
